sources.full: Marsh'Hael's Guide to the World with No Name

spell.name: Silver-Barbed Tongue

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself succeeds on an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw

entries: You magically distract the triggering creature and turn its momentary uncertainty into encouragement for another creature. The triggering creature must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract it from the {@dice d20}.

You can then choose a different creature you can see within range (you can choose yourself). The chosen creature gains a {@dice d4}, which it can choose to add to its AC for the attack if the triggering roll was an attack against them, or otherwise may add it to the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes within 1 minute. A creature can be empowered by only one use of this spell at a time.
This spell replaces the spell {@spell Silvery Barbs}.

spell.name: Strike True
entries: You extend your hand and point a finger at a target you can see in range. Any gap in the target's defenses are highlighted by bright light that seems to glow out of it, shedding dim light in a 10-foot radius. As long as the spell lasts, attack rolls against the affected creature have advantage. However, after every attack following the first, you must make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration as though you had been struck by the attack yourself (though you take no damage).

The number of attacks that will not cause a Constitution save increases by one when you reach 5th level (two attacks), and again when you reach 11th level (three attacks) and 17th level (four attacks).
This spell replaces the spell {@spell True Strike}.

spell.name: Arc Lightning

components.m: a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning

entries: A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out toward a creature within range, forming a sustained arc of lightning between you and the target. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 1d12} lightning damage, or half as much on a successful save. If they failed the saving throw, you can use your action on subsequent turns to deal {@damage 1d12} lightning damage to the target automatically. The spell ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.
This spell replaces the spell {@spell Witch Bolt}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|1-9|1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

monster.name: Dragonhelm Horror

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spell Immunity
entries: The horror is immune to three spells: {@spell fireball}, {@spell heat metal}, and {@spell lightning bolt}.

trait.name: Villain Actions
entries: The Dragonhelm Horror has three villain actions. It can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. It can take these actions in any order but can only use one per round.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horror makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Villain Action 1: Shield Shotput
entries: The horror throws its shield at a target of its choice with great force. The target takes {@damage 1d4 + 4} bludgeoning damage, and must also make a Con save at disadvantage ({@dc 14}). On a failed save, the target is {@condition stunned} until it takes damage or the start of the horror's next turn.

action.name: Villain Action 2: Constructed Resilience
entries: The horror regains hitpoints equal to half the damage dealt by the hardest-hitting attack it has suffered so far.

action.name: Villain Action 3: Fury of the Brass
entries: The horror uses an action surge (see {@class Fighter}).
Go on, go purge the kobold infestation. I'm sure it'll be easy enough for adventurers like you...

The Dragonhelm Horror is the construct that leads the Kobold infestation in the sewer beneath the Last Letter Inn. It resembles a {@creature Helmed Horror}, but the creature's head is an intricately constructed, functional clockwork replica of a dragonborn's skull.

bonus.name: Kobold Blast
entries: The horror immediately detonates a {@filter Kobold Underling |bestiary|source=egw|tag=kobold|miscellaneous=} corpse it can see. Then it calls out in Draconic for reinforcements, and another underling arrrives.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The siphoner has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the vampire's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Reconstruction
entries: The siphoner regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't on fire. If the siphoner takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The siphoner doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Mechanical Augmentation (1/day)
entries: If the creature would drop to zero hit points, it may instead make a Con save. The DC is the amount of damage from the attack that would have brought it to 0 hp. If it succeeds, it instead drops to 1 hit point.
Additionally, the creature always has advantage on saving throws against any spell or effect that would alter its form, and cannot choose to fail the saving throw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the siphoner regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.
The Kobold Siphoner was constructed alongside the {@filter Dragonhelm Horror|bestiary|source=worldwithnoname|miscellaneous=!reprinted} in order to siphon fate-energy from caught rat-catchers.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kobold casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Mechanical Augmentation (1/day)
entries: If the creature would drop to zero hit points, it may instead make a Con save. The DC is the amount of damage from the attack that would have brought it to 0 hp. If it succeeds, it instead drops to 1 hit point.
Additionally, the creature always has advantage on saving throws against any spell or effect that would alter its form, and cannot choose to fail the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kobold makes two Dagger or Chromatic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Chromatic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 feet, one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) of a type of the kobold's choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

These kobold magic-users were mechanomagically augmented, granted abilities similar to those of a {@filter Kobold Scale Sorcerer|bestiary|source=mpmm|Challenge Rating=[&1]|type=humanoid|miscellaneous=!adventure npc;spellcaster, charisma;!reprinted}, and placed in the sewer complex beneath the Last Letter Inn.

variantrule.name: Handheld Ranged Weapons and Disadvantage
entries: If your ranged players consistently find themselves in close quarters with monsters, you may consider using this optional variant.

If a character is within 5 feet of an enemy and is wielding a hand crossbow or any pistol, they may choose to negate the disadvantage imposed on their ranged attacks with that weapon. If they do so, all attack rolls against them have advantage until the start of their next turn.
